result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Case in court for return on doctors report.  Parties do not contest the report.   Court finds the defendant is competent to proceed and reinstates the proceedings. Remand is lifted.  Defense requests Preliminary Hearing date.

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Lucas William Stark in court with Attorney Fred Richardson.  Defendant Lucas William Stark in custody.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties appear in person.
Defendant has two cases before the court.
Prior to commencement of the hearing repeated outbursts and utterings by defendant.
Due to the disruptive nature Court orders defendant removed from the courtroom; competency hearing to proceed without defendant present in court.

Hearing commences:
Sworn and testified for the State:  Dr. Deborah Collins
Court took judicial notice of the doctor's report.
Arguments by the State and defense counsel.

Based upon the defendant's behavior in court and the testimony of Dr. Collins, the Court finds that the defendant is incompetent to proceed at this time, but if provided with appropriate treatment, is likely to become competent within the statutory time frame.  Court orders proceedings suspended.   Court ordered defendant committed to the Department of Health and Family Services for Institutional Care in order to restore competency. 

Court finds at this time he cannot order involuntary administration of medication.  The facility should petition the court.

Defendant is REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department for transportation to the designated facility.  Order of Commitment for Treatment (Incompetency) to be forwarded to the court for Judge's signature.  Court orders case adjourned for Return of Doctor's Report in Branch 28.  Defendant to be transported FORTHWITH.

Clerk:  jms
Competency hearing scheduled for April 28, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Lucas William Stark in court with Attorney Fred Richardson.  Defendant Lucas William Stark in custody.  Alexander James Geocaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties appear in person.
Defendant has two cases before the court.

Case called with defendant appearing via Zoom video; during the hearing due to technical difficulties with the sound, Court requests that defendant be brought to court.
Back on the record; defendant now present in court.
During the hearing, repeated interruptions and outbursts by defendant.
Court attempts to review the doctor's report with the parties.
Court halts the hearing and orders case adjourned for competency hearing in Branch 28.

Forensics confirmed Dr. Collins' availability as to the next court date.

Clerk:  jms
from Deborah L. Collins, Psy.D., ABPP dated March 29, 2022 - received

Order for Competency Examination by Department of Health Services 

-  signed by the Court (electronically)
Doctor's Report Return scheduled for March 31, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Court reinstates signature bond

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Melissa Jane Fitzsimmons in court, defendant Lucas William Stark not in court, in custody.  Alexander James Geocaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Both parties appear in person.
Defense counsel waives defendant's appearance for purposes of this hearing.
Defense counsel requests signature bond.

Court is advised that a competency evaluation has been ordered as to Case# 22CF00919.

Pursuant to Sec. 971.14(2) Wis. Stats., Court found probable cause, temporarily suspends proceedings, and ordered defendant to be examined by the Wisconsin Forensic Unit.  
Order For Competency Examination to be forwarded to the court for Judge's signature. 
Copy of signed order to be forwarded to the Forensic Unit.  Court ordered case adjourned for return of doctor's report in Branch 28.
Defendant is remanded pending return of doctor's report.

Court will address bail.

Clerk:  jms

Defendant has been picked up on the warrant.  Case is adjourned for return of warrant in Branch 28 on March 16, 2022.

Public Defender's office notified via electronic mail as to the next court date.

Clerk:  jms
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 1500.00.

Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness was present. The defendant having failed to appear, the court ordered a bench warrant to issue, any bond forfeited and Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification by the Clerk of Circuit Court.

Defendant Lucas William Stark in court with attorney Kathryn A Holtz.  Defendant Lucas William Stark in custody.  Mark O Thomson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
